member.name: T:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT
member.summary: Internal Ximea API enumerators for data formats.

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.MONO8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel. [Intensity] (see Note5,Note6)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.MONO16
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. [Intensity LSB] [Intensity MSB] (see Note5,Note6)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RGB24
member.summary: RGB data format. [Blue][Green][Red] (see Note5)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RGB32
member.summary: RGBA data format. [Blue][Green][Red][0] (see Note5)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RGBPLANAR
member.summary: RGB planar data format. [Red][Red]...[Green][Green]...[Blue][Blue]... (see Note5)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RAW8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel raw data from sensor. [pixel byte] raw data from transport (camera output)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RAW16
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel raw data from sensor. [pixel byte low] [pixel byte high] 16 bits (depacked) raw data

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.FRM_TRANSPORT_DATA
member.summary: Data from transport layer (e.g. packed). Depends on data on the transport layer (see Note7)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RGB48
member.summary: RGB data format. [Blue low byte][Blue high byte][Green low][Green high][Red low][Red high] (see Note5)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RGB64
member.summary: RGBA data format. [Blue low byte][Blue high byte][Green low][Green high][Red low][Red high][0][0] (Note5)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RGB16_PLANAR
member.summary: RGB16 planar data format

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RAW8X2
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel raw data from sensor(2 components in a row). [ch1 pixel byte] [ch2 pixel byte] 8 bits raw data from 2 channels (e.g. high gain and low gain channels of sCMOS cameras)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RAW8X4
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel raw data from sensor(4 components in a row). [ch1 pixel byte [ch2 pixel byte] [ch3 pixel byte] [ch4 pixel byte] 8 bits raw data from 4 channels (e.g. sCMOS cameras)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RAW16X2
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel raw data from sensor(2 components in a row). [ch1 pixel byte low] [ch1 pixel byte high] [ch2 pixel byte low] [ch2 pixel byte high] 16 bits (depacked) raw data from 2 channels (e.g. high gain and low gain channels of sCMOS cameras)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.RAW16X4
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel raw data from sensor(4 components in a row). [ch1 pixel byte low] [ch1 pixel byte high] [ch2 pixel byte low] [ch2 pixel byte high] [ch3 pixel byte low] [ch3 pixel byte high] [ch4 pixel byte low] [ch4 pixel byte high] 16 bits (depacked) raw data from 4 channels (e.g. sCMOS cameras)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.XI_RAW32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel raw data from sensor in integer format (LSB first). 4 bytes (LSB first) pixel (depacked) raw data

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG_FORMAT.XI_FLOAT32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel raw data from sensor in single-precision floating point format. 4 bytes per pixel (depacked) raw data

member.summary: Pointer to data. (see Note1)

member.summary: Filled buffer size. (see Note2)

member.summary: Format of image data get from GetImage.

member.summary: width of incoming image.

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG.height
member.summary: height of incoming image.

member.summary: Frame number. On some cameras it is reset by exposure, gain, downsampling change, auto exposure (AEAG).

member.summary: Seconds part of image timestamp (see Note3).

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG.tsUSec
member.summary: Micro-seconds part image timestamp (see Note3). Range 0-999999 us.

member.summary: Levels of digital inputs/outputs of the camera at time of exposure start/end (sample time and bits are specific for each camera model)

member.summary: Black level of image (ONLY for MONO and RAW formats). (see Note4)

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG.padding_x
member.summary: Number of extra bytes provided at the end of each line to facilitate image alignment in buffers.

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG.AbsoluteOffsetX
member.summary: Horizontal offset of origin of sensor and buffer image first pixel.

member.name: F:xiApi.XI_IMG.AbsoluteOffsetY
member.summary: Vertical offset of origin of sensor and buffer image first pixel.

member.summary: Current format of pixels on transport layer.

Trigger overlap modes
Trigger overlap modes No trigger overlap is permitted. If camera is in read-out phase, all triggers are rejected.
Trigger is accepted only when sensor is ready to start next exposure with defined exposure time. Trigger is rejected when sensor is not ready for new exposure with defined exposure time. (see Note1)
Trigger is accepted by camera any time. If sensor is not ready for the next exposure - the trigger is latched and sensor starts exposure as soon as exposure can be started with defined exposure time.
